name: Taj Mahal Hotel

reviews.text: You can't beat the Taj for service and style when you arrive. The staff took care of everything and made it very easy enjoy the stay. If I have one complaint it is the rooms are in need of updating. The old CRT TV's, dated rooms, hard beds and cramped bathrooms could use an upgrade because they are a let down after leaving the lobby.
reviews.title: Great lobby and service but rooms are dated.

reviews.text: It's a delight to be at Taj Mahal Palace New Delhi. One of the flagship hotels of Taj and gives you an wonderful experience... Each and every staff member gives his best to make your stay comfortable and memorable... Cheers to the team !
reviews.title: It's a delight to be at Taj Mansingh

reviews.text: A lovely hotel with gorgeous rooms and public areas and a good selections of nice places to eat. Fantastic service, staff couldn't do more for you and were very friendly. Room was clean, with plenty of storage space and comfy beds. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: very good experience ,very high level of service,even sometimes feel too much atention
reviews.title: excelent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room normal size but spotless,good breakfast and general hotel manteinance top notch
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: I stayed here a few days while sight-seeing in Delhi. As I've come to expect from the Taj chain, this hotel was great. The rooms were large and comfortable; mine included a nice view of the capital. The bed was soft. The bathroom was large, with a separate tub and walk-in shower. There are a couple of fantastic restaurants inside the hotel, including a Chinese placer and a sushi place. The service was impeccable, with people available to help me with all of my needs. Best of all, there is a huge, deep pool in the back of the hotel. It was perfect for swimming and lounging...
reviews.title: Another great Taj property

reviews.text: A great hotel with its very good services, and delighted interiors of the room as well as outdoor. Very nice food and its varities are so good. No hotel is as like TAJ. BUt it is costly.
reviews.title: Great Charm

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel several times for varying numbers of nights, using it as a base for short trips from Delhi. The service was friendly without being over familiar - there was a feel of a 'family' hotel. In spite of the size and busy-ness of the hotel, staff quickly learnt my name and routinely addressed me by name from the doormen up. Similarly, staff in the various restaurants and cafes quickly learnt my likes and dislikes.
reviews.title: Quiet comfort and outstanding service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was comfortable, always spotless and the views over New Delhi are fantastic. The calm, friendly but always professional atmosphere provided a welcome escape from the pressures of Delhi in monsoon season.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in

reviews.text: The main India restaurant, Varq, is worth a visit in its own right. A 'fine dining' restaurant, presenting traditional Indian food with a modern twist, staff are happy to advise on which selections will work well together and will discuss which dishes are hot, mild etc frankly and honestly.
reviews.title: My first choice when in New Delhi

reviews.text: I have stayed this hotel more than 5 times. Over 4 years, most of staffs have not changed and they greeted by my name. Their memory is amazing. Especially, I was very impressed one of lift security man. He always remembers my floor and press very quickly.
reviews.title: feel like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only down side of the hotel is breakfast. It is getting worse and worse. I believe the chef has changed. I could eat very little for breakfast. For Taj, they should really improve breakfast. Very disappointed.
reviews.title: Disappointment of elegant proportions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Taj’s Delhi branch is typically elegant (typical for a Taj), and well located but it was not busy in November, and it was dead on the weekend. We had dinner in its Grill Room on a Saturday and we were the only customers there all night---which gets things off to a spooky start. The food was nicely presented and graciously served, but the Grill Room features supposedly “continental” cuisine, all of which comes with a touch of indian flavoring—which is fine if that’s how you like your French food. Probably better to avoid the Grill Room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Concierge service was not satisfactory: The evening concierge assured me that the hotel’s representative would be first in line at the railroad ticket office on the morning of our departure to get two of the tickets that are held for day-of-journey sale to “last-minute” buyers, and that I could positively count on being on the right train. I should stop at the desk the next morning to pick up my tickets. He got a 1,000 rupee tip for his assurances—$20.00, the gross annual product for a smaller Indian village. The next morning there were no tickets waiting for us, and the day-time concierge had to make a couple of phone calls to be told (or so he reported): Their representative had gone to the station but there were no more tickets available. Maybe tomorrow?
reviews.title: The Only Place To Stay in Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest reason, however, for the low rating that we are giving the Delhj Taj is:
reviews.title: I expected a bit more...

reviews.text: We celebrated our wedding there and it was a awesome expreience with TAJ and we also spent our 1 st night at taj it was seriously a quality time spent at taj which i cant forget in my life...thanks to taj for making my day a memorable day of my life.
reviews.title: Awesome expreience with Taj

reviews.text: This was a fantastic hotel which oozed decadence. We had stayed in Taj hotels elsewhere in India and had similar experiences but this one topped the lot.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resturants were varied and wonderful.
reviews.title: Ignore the exterior - this is a fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My young children were well looked after and catered for.
reviews.title: Amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You were greated with freshly squeezed juice in your room, as you arrived. Belgian chocolates and other luxuries.
reviews.title: So good.....

reviews.text: Have stayed and dine here in this hotel many times. The food ranges from average to bad and the staff have ego issues. The restaurant staff is very indifferent and unfriendly. The service ranges from being on-the-face to abrupt.
reviews.title: Horrible food and staff

reviews.text: The rooms are over stuffed with furniture and heavy fabrics- making them claustrophobic at times. The rooms are not even well maintained and often there is dust on flat surfaces and curtains are laden with dust- not good for someone with a dust allergy.
reviews.title: Superb Luxury Hotel within its own peaceful Oasis

reviews.text: The staff are always hovering for tips.
reviews.title: great food, ambiance & service

reviews.text: Stay at the Oberoi, Leela or ITC instead.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The review is a tad bit late. We have stopped staying here from the last 2 years or so.
reviews.title: Great location and great experience

reviews.text: You want to really like this hotel because the excellent staff tries so hard, but the hotel needs a refurbishment. My executive floor room smelled of mold and required a dehumidifier to keep the smell out. The first dehumidifier was broken and internet connections at a steep fee were slow to point of unusable.
reviews.title: Tired Taj

reviews.text: The hotel looks grand and is in the centre of lutyens Delhi. The check in was quick. The room was a disappointment, with a good possibility of rooms not having been upgraded for over 10 years i would say. I mean, there was no flat screen tv, no dock for charging your smart phone. They clearly have not prioritised spending money on basic upgrades.
reviews.title: Old rooms but the service makes up for it...

reviews.text: But the service is excellent! Absolutely fantastic. And the breakfast, which is complimentary was among the best I have had! fabulous service, good food, the only downside was the rooms. But go for the service.
reviews.title: Wah Taj...

reviews.text: The rooms are excellent and very comfortable, quiet and with good facilities. Staff are friendly and helpful. The pool is also a great place to relax and for the children to play, or catch up on reading/writing, etc.
reviews.title: keep coming back

reviews.text: the food is excellent and reasonably priced...........keep it up..!!
reviews.title: Superior service

reviews.text: Staying at a Taj property really is a surreal experience. Staying at the Taj Mahal Hotel in Delhi is truly unmatched in many ways.
reviews.title: A true Taj experience

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel since it is an ideal location for a media event and were taken aback at the politeness and helpful nature of the staff. It's got something to do with their training, I suppose, but the way they go out of their way in order to make sure their guests are happy is something to commend.
reviews.title: Stay at Taj Mahal

reviews.text: The hotel is architecturally pleasant although some of the Taj properties are quite magnificent. The lunch buffet was wonderful with a wide variety of options, serving the palates of all types of guests. The pool is well maintained and extremely clean.
reviews.title: Good and secure place to have corporate events

reviews.text: The rooms were incredible, both in decor and in cleanliness.
reviews.title: Best hotel i've ever stayed at

reviews.text: A true Taj experience to say the least... I would most certainly love to stay here again
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.text: 11th floor room with city view was very quiet. 7 by 8 meter room with green carpet, slightly stiff pillows. 42" flat-screen TV, DVD player available. Amenities included fax/phone, mini-fridge, white marble desk, amoir, fresh fruit, safe, white marble bath (with shower ), built-in AC electrical adaptors, personal wake-up calls. Great service.
reviews.title: Quiet and very comfortable

reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel especially if you stay at the club level with butler service. While pricey, everything is exactly the way it should be. Rooms are clean, service fantastic, food is wonderful. After all the noise and crowded streets of Delhi, it is so nice to be able to return to this oasis. The gardens are fantastic at night - just a great place to relax. The Taj does it right.
reviews.title: The Best in New Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights right at the start of our holiday. I wanted to stay somewhere nice coming off the back of a Business Class flight.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent service - great place to stay in Delhi

reviews.text: The Taj Mahal in Delhi didn't disappoint. We were met at the airport by a hotel car - we had a transfer as part of the Club Room - and whisked to the hotel. Upon arrival we were given cold towels to freshen up and checked in with a freshly squeezed juice.
reviews.title: Impeccable, yet friendly, service

reviews.text: The Club room also gave us access to the Club lounge where for an hour or so every evening you had free drinks and nibbles. Staff there were very friendly and went out of their way to help you...and give you a good drink!
reviews.title: Great Place for Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and the service at the hotel is definitely 5 star. Even though the restaurant was really busy during breakfast - you still get personalized attention. The restaurant staff even remembered what our drinks in the morning were the next time we showed up. The buffet was scrumptious. Something for everyone & my husband and I really loved the diverse food. There were fresh fruit juices, fruit, a ton of pastries, indian, asian and american breakfast foods.
reviews.title: Great hotel with impeccable service but needs some room upgrades

reviews.text: When we arrived, we were given a room upgrade. Our room was on the second floor of the hotel and apparently, some rooms on the first floor were being refurbished so we heard a lot of hammering, drilling and etc even after 7pm. We were disappointed in that the room was very dated. I can't remember the last time we visited a hotel that didn't have a flat screen t.v. The furnishings were a bit dated, the shower curtain was a white flimsy panel, the room was small. The mattress was hard and the sheets were not soft. We were shocked to know that this was an upgraded room, i'm afraid to know what our original room would have looked like. Nevertheless, at least the hotel is moving in the right direction and rooms are upgraded. The common areas are beautiful and well decorated. The service at the hotel was excellent. The staff was very warm and courteous. Housekeeping did a great job. The room was very clean and each day, they replenished the bottle water supply. Which you can't get enough of since the city is very smoggy / congested. The tap is not safe to drink, so you have to rinse with bottled water after brushing your teeth. Anyhow, I would have given this hotel an excellent rating if not for the disappointing room.
reviews.title: Great place to be, a tad expensive though

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in November and had a lovely time. The staff were gracious, sensitive and so attentive, from the welcome by Concierge and Reception through to the staff in the restaurant. I had a beautiful room and felt thoroughly relaxed. This is indeed a rarity in a large city like Delhi. I do think the hotel is an outstanding place to be.
reviews.title: Impressive building, but too big to offer the personal touch

reviews.text: You can't fault the architecture and the grounds - both are magnificent - but the hotel does give the impression that it's size does undermine the opportunity to offer a personal touch. Has more of a feel that it is a business than a service provider.
reviews.title: Old world charm packaged in modern business hotel

reviews.text: This is a nice place with wonderful service that echoes Taj's exemplary service standards. Sure there are niggling problems. The room cards did not work. The breakfast spread was spartan. But the sheer atmosphere of a period hotel, compensates all ills. If not anything else, just stay there for morning views from the back side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellence in Delhi - Service beyond compare, Sublime Indo-Chinese Food

reviews.text: I've flown over 150,000 miles this year, so I've seen my share of deluxe hotels, and I will quickly commend this one to you. Located in a beautiful and peaceful area of New Delhi close to tourist sites such as the India Gate, Connaught Place, Rajpath, and Lodi Gardens, the hotel makes a perfect base for touring. Transport is easy, with choices of hotel cars, cabs, or tuk-tuks, the latter easily accessed just outside the hotel gates.
reviews.title: Service Really Shines at the Taj

reviews.text: Upon drive-up, you appreciate both the security standards and the country club feel. I stayed 3 nights and was impressed by the number of staffers who became familiar with me and took the time to learn my name. All my requests were met with a smile and efficient responses, and the entire property was immaculate, which is no easy achievement considering the dust and grit of Delhi.
reviews.title: Taj Mahal Hotel, Delhi

likes.liked: — Honestly speaking, since it is a Taj group's hotel the interior is fine but nothing else

reviews.text: The hotel offers a superb range of both restaurant venues and menu selections, along with attentive and kind service. The hamburger at Machan was one of the best I'd ever had, and when I mentioned it to my server, he produced the senior chef to my table to accept the compliment. I was impressed that the restaurant managers are both visible and friendly, and it was obvious that the staff want customers to have a good experience.
reviews.title: Lovely Interior

likes.liked: — Provide all the things you need for a comfortable stay

reviews.text: The pool area is large and inviting and the team in the steam and sauna area of the spa takes care of you in a fashion normally only seen in ultra high-dollar athletic clubs.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel, love the view!

reviews.text: Noise suppression in guest rooms is excellent and the bedding luxurious and comfortable. My room had a large flat panel tv, and even the draperies, fan speed, and room lights could be managed by a bed-side console. While everything in the room seemed recent and fresh, I personally found the style and decor a little dull, but that is a tiny point overall.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: I stay their regularly during my Delhi. This is one of the best hotels in Delhi both in terms of location and service. Very conveniently located near Khan market and other tourist attraction. For business travelers like myself, this is perfectly located near to central business district in Delhi. The service is great. Of the 20 odd times I have stayed, I have always had perfect service except once when the check-in person was trying to find my booking in name of my father (reading my name as my father's name in passport). You get complimentary upgrades often and it has good choices of restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed on the 11th floor and the views were stunning. All you see is a green carpet of trees and in the distance the President's Palace and other buildings from the colonial era. Sunsets and sunrises take your breath away. I used to live in Delhi and could not believe I could get a view like this in Delhi. The hospitality at the hotel is amazing, great pool, gym. The food is excellent especially at the Japanese restaurant Wasabi and the Chinese restaurant. The hotel is pricey but you can get some good deals in summer. It is walking distance to Khan market and India gate- lovely walks just outside the hotel with many boulevards with beautiful old trees. The staff are very friendly. I left my mobile and passport in the locker- they had kept it safely and I picked it up on my return.
reviews.title: Beautiful sunsets!

reviews.text: I had booked the Taj Club Room and offered a complementary Chauffer drive from the airport in a Jaguar XF. The hotel staff reconfrimed my flight timings a day prior and I also received the chauffer's mobile number by a text message. However I didn't need to use it as the chauffer was waiting before time in the arrival hall and greeted me courteously. The car had a couple of water bottles, cold towels, newspapers, magazines and a hanger for jackets to make it comfortable for the guest. The chauffer was in touch with the hotel staff and I was welcomed at the porch as soon as I alighted from the car. The staff member warmly greeted me and escorted me to my room.
reviews.title: Taj Delhi

reviews.text: Great service.
reviews.title: Excellent place for business travellers

reviews.text: This is one of the best properties in the city of Delhi. With serene and peaceful surroundings, it is stone throw distance from Khan Market, a must visit place for shoppers and visitors to Delhi. One can have beautiful view of central Delhi including the Parliament house of India from the rooms located on the front side of the hotel. The Gym and Spa are fantastic and so is the Machan restaurant and Ricks bar.
reviews.title: Experience the warmth of Indian hospitality at its best

reviews.text: The lobby is vast and extensive. Rooms very good. Food, great!!
reviews.title: 5 star quality

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located, but I guess it is one of the disadvantages. Inspite of having a huge campus, you can still hear the traffic sound. The Bed was awesome, pillows and coushions wonderful. The TV picture quality was not that good (While you may be thinking if it matters at all, welll, to me, it does). The Bathroom was spacious, helps you indulge in your tub-bathing :)
reviews.title: WaahTaj......... Its really a superb hotel

reviews.text: Hospitality was great (as expected). Well, theres nothing more to add, except to reiterate that it is an excellent place to stay.
reviews.title: A Rejuvenating Evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was been there to attend a meeting over there... it was really a nice hotel where i enjoyed a lot. and the thing which was exciting Indian film actors Saif and kareena were also staying over there ... isaw both of them.
reviews.title: An experience

reviews.text: Staying at The Club Room had it's perks, well, I became privy to this knowledge only after checking in. The room was fantastic. Especially, the beds, comfortable and had just the right amount of cushioning. Great.
reviews.title: Wonderful

description: The Taj Mahal Hotel is one of the most distinguished addresses in Lutyens’ Delhi, and reflects the heritage of Mughal Delhi. Graceful architecture blends aesthetically with modern facilities. The hotel is a city landmark, centrally located, in close proximity to some key areas of the capital. The 294 rooms and suites are luxuriously appointed with the latest in in-room comforts, and all are “rooms with a view” which adds to the guest experience.
